messages.title: Delivering for Newcastle North
messages.content: Always putting local people first. Fighting for local jobs and investment. Standing up for our public services.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Wants Newcastle North to be a place where businesses can start up and prosper, and to promote good quality jobs for local people.
Standing up for properly-funded public services and protecting them from Tory cuts.
Protecting education funding from Tory cuts.
Standing up for our NHS and social care services.

issues.economy: Fighting for a fairer economy that works for everyone.
issues.education: Protecting education funding from Tory cuts.
issues.health: Standing up for our NHS and social care services.
issues.labourEmployment: Fighting for local jobs and investment in our area.

community.content: Always putting local people first. Fighting for local jobs and investment.

leaflet.personalStatement: It's been a huge privilege to have represented Newcastle North as your Member of Parliament since 2010.

politicalExperience.achievements: Raised her own family in Newcastle, passionate about getting the best deal for Newcastle North and everyone who lives here.

contactInformation.address: The Lemington Centre, Tyne View, Newcastle upon Tyne NE15 8RZ

endorsements.endorsement: 'Catherine gets involved with so much locally, and clearly knows and really cares about our area. That's what we need in our local MP, and why I want to see her re-elected here in Newcastle North.'

'Catherine has worked hard to give local people an effective voice in Parliament over the last seven years. I know she will continue to fight on our behalf for local public services, like schools and the NHS.'

endorsements.endorser: Hari Shukla CBE, Chapel House equality campaigner
endorsements.endorsement: 'Ever since she was first elected, I've been proud to have had Catherine as my MP. She works tirelessly to champion Newcastle North and our diverse local people, and is always there to support local people.'

images.caption: Fighting for local jobs and investment in our area.
Standing up for our public services.

personalStories.story: It's been a huge privilege to have represented Newcastle North as your Member of Parliament since 2010.

examples: John Dawson MBE: 'Catherine gets involved with so much locally, and clearly knows and really cares about our area. That's what we need in our local MP, and why I want to see her re-elected here in Newcastle North.'

Joanne Kerr, Burton Park nurse: 'Catherine has worked hard to give local people an effective voice in Parliament over the last seven years. I know she will continue to fight on our behalf for local public services, like schools and the NHS.'

Hari Shukla CBE, Chapel House equality campaigner: 'Ever since she was first elected, I've been proud to have had Catherine as my MP. She works tirelessly to champion Newcastle North and our diverse local people, and is always there to support local people.'
Standing up for properly-funded public services and protecting them from Tory cuts.
Theresa May: Standing up for properly-funded public services and protecting them from Tory cuts.
